result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel Gaona Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
- No violent contact with the victim for purposes of seeing the child/ren.

- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Defendant to complete Parenting Classes.

timeConds.notes: - Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel Gaona Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Defendant Manuel Gaona in court.  Charles Kreger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $444.00 entered as ordered by the court on 06/28/2016  to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 05/01/2017. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Received, signed and filed:
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs.
Paperwork forwarded to Clerk of Court's Office for processing.
cab

Defendant Manuel Gaona in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
State is ready to proceed to trial.
Case passed....
.
Back on the record, same appearances.  Defendant wants to change his plea.
.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
.

Sentencing proceeded.
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statement/s by:   Chanel F.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 1 year with the following conditions:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Defendant to complete Parenting Classes.
- No violent contact with the victim for purposes of seeing the child/ren.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Manuel Gaona in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense informs the court that the case will remain calendared for jury trial on 06/20/2016 at 08:30 a.m.
Offers revoked.

Defendant Manuel Gaona in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Defendant did not appear until 09:00 a.m.
Defense counsel was in court earlier and  has received discovery and an offer.  Case is adjourned for a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 36.  
Defendant was given court dates when he appeared in court.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Manuel Gaona in court.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by the Defendant.  The Court finds that the Defendant is indigent and does qualifiy for representation at the County's expense.   The court appointed Attorney Cherella to represent the defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour;  Attorney Cherella accepted the appointment.    Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month.  Order received, signed and filed; and forwarded to counsel on today's date.
Defense counsel received discovery.
Case calendared for a scheduling conference in branch 36.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

16RM017142  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/18/2016

Defendant Manuel Gaona in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is NOT ELIGIBLE for Public Defender Representation. Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant advised court that he will be retaining private counsel. Defendant made a request to modify the No Contact Order. Court Denies his request at this time. The case is calendared for Scheduling Conference in Br. 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Chanel F.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Manuel Gaona in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 36.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
